result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela D Cook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 0 Days.
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: Any Other Sentence Being Served.
Consecutive to: Any Other Sentence Being Served.

miscConds.notes:
Cost and Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $50.00 per month starting 12-01-2015 and/or 52 hours of Community Service to be completed by the completion of Probation. Court must receive notice of completion prior to due date.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Follow through with rehabilitation program.
Be involved in a 12 step program at least 2 times a week within 30 days and obtain a mentor/sponsor within 60 days.
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Maintain valid driver's license.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA Sample, if not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

Defendant should be transferred to prison in mid June and requests a plea and sentencing prior.  
Defendant to be held at WCJ until the next hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Angela D Cook in court, in custody, with attorney Katie Bricco for Jorge R Fragoso.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
